meanings.definition: To make something or someone appear more attractive or exciting.
meanings.sent1: She used sparkly decorations to glamourize her room for the party.
meanings.sent2: The fashion designer wanted to glamourize the runway show with elegant gowns.
meanings.sent3: Trying to glamourize a messy room with a single flower was a funny sight.
meanings.sent4: The artist's brush seemed to glamourize the plain canvas into a masterpiece.
meanings.sent5: The magician's wand had the power to glamourize ordinary objects into treasures.

meanings.definition: To give a glamorous or attractive appearance to something or someone.
meanings.sent1: The makeup artist knew how to glamourize the actress for the red carpet event.
meanings.sent2: The interior designer wanted to glamourize the living room with luxurious furniture.
meanings.sent3: Trying to glamourize a pet rock with a tiny bow tie was quite amusing.
meanings.sent4: The sunset seemed to glamourize the sky with its vibrant colors.
meanings.sent5: The photographer's lens had the ability to glamourize any scene into a work of art.
